{"metadata":{"objective":"Rebutting an argument","lastStepAudioPath":""},"steps":[{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"><strong>You are</strong></span> voting in a city-wide referendum about a school board proposal to have kids go to school all year round.<br /><br />You have reviewed the school board&#39;s argument and its evidence.<br /><br /><strong><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\">Your next step</span></strong> is understand what makes a good rebuttal, and then review what those opposed to this plan have to say.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;font-size:15px;\"><strong>Try it!</strong></span><br /><br /><span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\"><span style=\"color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Arial; white-space: pre-wrap;\">Note for screen readers: Press Alt + 1 , or option + 1 on Mac, to open the try it information box in a new window and access information needed to answer some of the questions. In the content, this needed information is described as being in the box or table to the right.</span></span></p>","rightText":"<table border=\"2\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\"><tbody><tr><td><p><strong>Year-round school proposal</strong></p><p>The school board proposes that kids go to school year-round because this provides a more effective educational experience.</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","headerText":"People in the community disagree"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>A <strong>rebuttal</strong> or <strong>counter-argument</strong> is a type of argument used to challenge the original argument.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"A diagram shows three stages of an argument: the argument, the rebuttal, and the counter-rebuttal.   In the argument stage, the school board makes its argument.  In the rebuttal stage, the opponents attack the argument. In the counter-rebuttal stage, the school board attacks the rebuttal and supports the argument.  This mini-lesson is about the rebuttal stage in which the opponents attack the school board's argument.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"Preparing a rebuttal"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>Here are three strategies you can use to rebut an argument:<br />&nbsp;</p><ul><li>If the argument is based on <strong>facts or data</strong>, point out flaws or gaps in the information.<br />&nbsp;</li><li>If the argument is based on <strong>logic</strong>, attack the logic.<br />&nbsp;</li><li>If the argument is based on <strong>expert opinion</strong>, try to discredit it.<br />&nbsp;</li></ul><p>You can also attack the reasons for the argument (the <em>becaus</em>e).<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":""},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":1,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>This argument uses <strong>data</strong> as evidence:<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">Marcus Billingsley is an excellent CEO because he is very popular and successful.&nbsp; </span><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">In a recent poll, more than 90% of those surveyed said that they approve of the job that Billingsley is doing</span>.</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>What is the flaw or gap in the data?<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_c0d08414-011a-c51b-c085-5bb2f0de3097\" style=\"width: 200px; Some states do not require yearly car inspections and most of their cars are safe.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>What is the problem with the logic of the evidence?<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_37c8ee26-23c1-64d0-4237-44714e9e558c\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">MC Placeholder<br /><strong>ID: mc_37c8...</strong></jumc></p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":0},"leftText":"<p>This argument offers an <strong>expert opinion</strong> as evidence:<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">We need to fund research into ways to protect the endangered Mountain Gorilla.&nbsp; The school board&#39;s evidence is in the box to the right.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"The opponents' rebuttal"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">From the school board&#39;s argument:</span><br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">Students do better on international tests of academic achievement in countries where the school year is longer.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>What gaps or flaws in the data can the plan&#39;s opponents point to?&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_8fa9eed0-eff0-d389-b263-5b6071a2d78b\" style=\"width: 200px; Which piece of expert opinion can they use to rebut the school board&#39;s evidence?<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_bd312002-d923-c45c-449b-f451b20333a1\" style=\"width: 200px; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">MC Placeholder<br /><strong>ID: mc_b304...</strong></jumc></p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>The plan&#39;s opponents can rebut the school board&#39;s argument in a few ways:</p><ul style=\"padding-left:15px;\"><li>They can point to flaws or weaknesses in evidence.</li><li>They can introduce new evidence that contradicts the school board&#39;s evidence.</li><li>They can attack the logic of the school board&#39;s claim or reason.<br />&nbsp;</li></ul>","rightText":"<table border=\"2\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">The opponents&#39; rebuttal:</span><br />&nbsp;<p>Numerous studies of U.S. schools have shown no academic improvement from year-round schooling.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; In addition, more frequent short breaks throughout the year would make childcare harder to arrange.&nbsp; Experts such as Dr. Seth Gershenson have found that a longer school year primarily benefits strong students, not those who are likely to lose educational gains during the summer.&nbsp; Finally, school is not the only place where students learn and develop.&nbsp; Unstructured time to play and explore increases creativity and problem-solving skills.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","headerText":"Putting it all together"}],"overviewHeader":"Overview","inputData":{"mc_a90616aa-0f63-0801-b94f-6a5464aa3b17":{"displayType":"MC","noOfChoices":2,"selectdTry":2,"selectedColumn":1,"choices":[{"text":"More  frequent short breaks throughout the year would make childcare harder to arrange.","fixed":false},{"text":"Children need large stretches of unsupervised time to develop independence.","fixed":false,"incFeedback":"This does not address the expense and logistical issues for those who want to provide supervision for their children."},{"fixed":false,"text":"Mr. Aplomb could reduce the noise he hears by insulating his house better.","incFeedback":"The issue of insulation does not address the question of whether ownership provides certain rights."},{"fixed":false},{"fixed":false}],"selectedTry":2,"correct":0,"correctFeedback":"This is a gap in the school board's logic. Unstructured time to play and explore increases creativity and problem-solving skills.","fixed":false},{"text":"The school board should be focused on reducing expense, not on increasing it","fixed":false,"incFeedback":"This does not address the issue of whether year-round school provides a more effective educational experience."},{"fixed":false,"text":"I have been living in my house longer than Mr. Aplomb has been living in his. It is not an effective way of discrediting an opinion by an expert."},{"fixed":false},{"fixed":false},{"fixed":false}],"selectedTry":2,"correct":0,"correctFeedback":"This would be an effective way of discrediting the expert opinion.","prompt":""},"mc_8fa9eed0-eff0-d389-b263-5b6071a2d78b":{"displayType":"MC","noOfChoices":2,"selectdTry":2,"selectedColumn":1,"choices":[{"text":"Numerous studies of U.S. schools have shown no academic improvement from year-round schooling.","fixed":false},{"text":"In addition to longer school days and year-round schooling, all public school districts in the United States should require students in all grades to wear uniforms.","fixed":false,"incFeedback":"This is not a rebuttal of the school board's evidence.  Rather, it is another argument."},{"fixed":false},{"fixed":false},{"fixed":false}],"selectedTry":2,"correct":0,"correctFeedback":"In this rebuttal, the opponents show that the school board's data does not tell the whole story."}},"rightFloatText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-cktitle\" style=\"color:#025B5B;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:22px;font-weight:bold;\">Year-round school</span><br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">The school board&#39;s argument with evidence:</span><br /><br />Kids should go to school year-round because this provides a more effective educational experience.&nbsp; Students do better on international tests of academic achievement in countries where the school year is longer.&nbsp; In addition, according to experts like Dr. Michaela Smith, numerous studies have shown that students lose educational gains over the summer and must spend valuable time each fall recovering what they have lost. Having a longer school year would reduce expense and logistical issues.</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>"}
